lead_paragraph: Though the punishments — lashings and six-month prison terms — were suspended, they could be carried out if any of the six defendants commit further actions deemed illegal in Iran.
abstract: Group of Iranian men and women who where arrested in May for videotaping themselves dancing to Pharrel Williams song Happy are sentenced to 91 lashes and six months in prison; all punishments have been suspended, but could be carried out if they commit further actions deemed illegal in Iran.

snippet: Prospects for an agreement over Iran’s nuclear program appeared to suffer a setback when a United Nations monitoring agency said the Iranians had yet to meet two measures to ensure that their activities are peaceful.
lead_paragraph: Prospects for an agreement over Iran’s nuclear program appeared to suffer a setback when a United Nations monitoring agency said the Iranians had yet to meet two measures to ensure that their activities are peaceful.
abstract: Report by International Atomic Energy Agency in Vienna finds that Iran has yet to meet two measures to assure Western powers that uranium was not for weapons, dimming prospects for an agreement over Iran's nuclear program.

lead_paragraph: In a victory for President Hassan Rouhani over hard-liners, Iranians can now do what people elsewhere have long done without thinking — easily send and receive photos and videos on their phones.
abstract: Iranians are now permitted to send and receive photos and videos on their cellphones, marking victory for Pres Hassan Rouhani, who has long called for relaxing Iran's tight grip on the Internet but has had only limited success in the face of stern opposition from hard-liners.

lead_paragraph: The latest sanctions from the Obama administration come amid signs that Iran’s military is resisting efforts to open up its nuclear program to deeper inspection.
abstract: Obama administration, amid signs that Iran's military is resisting efforts to open its nuclear program to deeper inspection, imposes sanctions on several Iranian organizations; since talks were extended, Iran has missed major deadline to provide information about its nuclear research, declared it will not allow visits to military site suspected of being part of nuclear component testing and said it is completing work on far more powerful centrifuges to make nuclear fuel.

snippet: The export of condensates is not fully covered by Western restrictions on Iran’s trade, and the country is making increasing use of the quirk.
lead_paragraph: The export of condensates is not fully covered by Western restrictions on Iran’s trade, and the country is making increasing use of the quirk.
abstract: Iranian customs data shows that country is finding way around Western sanctions to export increasing amounts of ultralight oil to China and other Asian markets, expanding value of its trade by potentially billions of dollars a year; energy experts say Iran is counting on West to tolerate increasing export stream due to slight thaw in relations as negotiations over Iran's nuclear program continue.

headline.print_headline: With Gas Byproduct, Iran Sidesteps Sanctions

abstract: Arrest of Iranian-American Jason Rezaian of The Washington Post, along with his journalist wife Yeganeh Salehi, by Iranian authorities alarms the foreign press corps and highlights split between Iran’s Pres Hassan Rouhani and state institutions that hold the real power; Post says it has not been given any explanation for Rezaian's arrest or any information on his condition.

snippet: The passenger plane, which is based on a relatively obscure Ukrainian design, is assembled under license in Iran and has been involved in previous Iranian air disasters.
lead_paragraph: The passenger plane, which is based on a relatively obscure Ukrainian design, is assembled under license in Iran and has been involved in previous Iranian air disasters.
abstract: Locally built Iranian passenger plane crashes shortly after takeover in Tehran, killing 39 people and reviving questions about safety of aviation sector left hobbled by international sanctions; plane, which is based on a relatively obscure Ukrainian design, is assembled under license in Iran and has been involved in previous Iranian air disasters.
